[[File:Saturn and Titan.webp|right|200px|thumb|Titan orbiting Saturn]]
'''Titan''' is [[Wikipedia:Saturn|Saturn]]'s largest moon.
==Naming conventions==
Titan's mountains (called ''montes'')<ref group=note>''Montes'', pl. of ''mons'', is [[Latin]] for 'mountains' and is used in planetary nomenclature to create international names for mountains on celestial bodies.</ref> are named after mountains in [[Middle-earth]] while ''colles'',<ref group=note>''Colles'', pl. of ''collis'', is Latin for 'hills', and used in international planetary nomenclature.</ref> are named after characters created by [[Tolkien]].<ref>{{webcite|author=IAU Working Group for Planetary System Nomenclature|articleurl=https://planetarynames.wr.usgs.gov/Page/Categories|articlename=Categories (Themes) for Naming Features on Planets and Satellites|dated=|website=planetarynames.wr.usgs.gov|accessed=4 February 2024}}</ref>
